TEXT.TITLE: TAIWAN ISSUES MORE CDS TO CURB MONEY SUPPLY GROWTH
TEXT.BODY: The central bank has issued 5.3 billion Taiwan dlrs of certificates of deposits (CDs), boosting CD issues so far this year to 140.42 billion compared with 16 billion issued in the same 1986 period. The new CDs, with maturities of six months, one year and two years, carry interest rates ranging from 4.07 to 5.12 pct, a bank spokesman told Reuters. The issues are aimed at helping curb the growth of M-1b money supply, the result of large foreign exchange reserves now at more than 53 billion U.S. Dlrs. REUTER
